intro: Colletia cruzerillo, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a somewhat hairy texture. Colletia cruzerillo is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
